educations.schoolName: Alfred State College - SUNY College of Technology

headline: Investigative Analyst at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: 10-plus years of experience as a paralegal in the US Army showcased my strengths of analytics, social engineering, and global communication and networking, leading me into the intelligence field. Skilled in Microsoft Word, Operational Planning, Analytical Analysis, and Management. Strong human resources professional with a Bachelorâs Degree focused in Social and Criminal Justice from Ashford University.

positions.description: Served as principle assistant to Chief Counsel; responsible for all aspects of paralegal operations, to include, but not limited to, legal aspects of domestic operations, military justice systems, administrative justice systems and military technician adverse administrative actions; legal office management operations, including law research capabilities, accountability of government property, preventative law program, and financial disclosure management program; primarily responsible for the training, mentoring and enhancement of the rest of the agencies paralegal personnel.
positions.title: Senior Paralegal

positions.companyName: International and Operational Law Division, Office of The Judge Advocate General, US Army
positions.description: Provided administrative, logistical and technical support for the Judge Advocate General's Corps' Predeployment Training, Operational Law Secure Video Teleconference, client services and PDP operations; provided information and updates to senior JAG Corps leadership; prepared updated and maintained databases and PDP website, spreadsheets, records, calendars, logs and $350K travel budget; and conducted active correspondence world-wide in support of PDP operations.
positions.title: NCOIC, Predeployment Preparation Synch Cell

positions.description: Served as the technical and procedural legal adviser to five commanders.  Acted as liaison between four separate legal offices and the five commanders I served.  Was responsible for the proper preparation, reporting and filing of over 200 legal documents, including: Wills, powers of attorney, applications for citizenship, nonjudicial punishment, AR 15-6 investigations, financial liability investigations of property loss, general officer memorandums of reprimand, administrative separations, officer eliminations and notaries.  Established a standard operating procedure for all legal actions in the brigade and developed a quick reference matrix for all investigations.  Assisted in training over 3300 people in escalation of force, rules for the use of force and the law of war.  Trained approximately 40 Air Force and Nave executive office on procedures for conducting Army investigations and nonjudicial punishment.  Oversaw movement of over 3300 personnel to and from the airport upon reception, on leave, and as they deployed.  Created and maintained a security clearance access roster for 900 Service Members.  Successfully collected over 1500 samples from individuals for drug testing, with 100% accuracy.  Recorded over 5000 miles as a driver for the Joint Visitor's Bureau without a motor vehicle accident or traffic violation.  Transported and shipped over $1M of classified material as an official courier.  Managed and distributed fleet of over 30 government vehicles for six month period.
positions.title: Senior Paralegal

positions.companyName: Combined Joint Task Force Phoenix VII
positions.description: Served as military justice paralegal for task force Chief Prosecutor. Provided litigation support to trial counsel during plea bargains and contested court proceedings, including resolution of logistical issues, assistance in the preparation of documents, and coordination of travel/lodging of witnesses, leading to a 100% conviction rate throughout the task force. Assisted in the preparation of form separation documents and checklists, which were used throughout the task force, and documents for dozens of non-judicial punishment actions. Was responsible for tracking separation actions throughout the task force. Assisted litigation counsel and commanders in connection with all levels of non-judicial proceedings. Assisted office legal assistance attorneys in the provision of legal assistance to hundreds of clients. Served as the Information Management Officer (IMO) for the legal office.
positions.title: Paralegal
